intro: Asphodelus albus var. ramosus, commonly known as the white asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllis family (Amaryllidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It produces a bulbous stem that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. The flowers bloom in spring and are often used in traditional medicine and ornamental gardening.
